summary:
Shishani is a talented singer-songwriter loved for her smooth and powerful voice. Her roots are Namibian and Belgian in origin, but she grew up mainly in the Netherlands.

In her work she bring these worlds together. Her vocal style has been influenced by Afro-American and African music traditions, giving her a truly unique sound.Her music is comforting and has a thread of strong social consciousness running through it. Her song “Minority” garnered two nominations at the Namibian Annual Music Awards. She has also been credited with a host of awards, both locally and internationally. In 2014, she was a finalist in the prestigious Radio France International Discovery Awards.

During her career, Shishani has performed in the Netherlands, Germany, France, Germany, Czech Republic, Poland, Ireland, Greece, Italy, India, Malawi, Morocco, Kenya, South Africa, and her twin homes, Belgium and Namibia.

Shishani has also spearheaded various arts initiatives in Namibia focusing on social upliftment. She is a founder of ARTNAM; advocating for the promotion of Namibian arts.

In her work as an anthropologist / musicologist she has specialised in contemporary urban Namibian music. Currently she is writing for the Bloomsbury Encyclopaedia of Contemporary Music of the World.  


Shishani means ‘crown’ in Oshiwambo, one of Namibia's native languages.

treasury_media.title: Shishani - Minority (Jazz remix)
treasury_media.description:
Music & Lyrics written by Shishani. 
Music recorded at Cabanon Studio, Windhoek, Namibia 2012.
Video by Endemic productions, 2012.

Song & Video nominated for Namibian Annual Music Awards 2012 + 2013.

awards.title: Finalist - Radio France International Discovery Awards 2014
awards.description:
Shishani is one of the ten finalists in the Radio France International Discovery Awards 2014 - a competition celebrating the ten best newcomers from the African continent.
VOTE: www.prixdecouvertes.com/en/vote > until 30 October 2014.

awards.title: Winner Best Artist - 'Cultuur in de Stad'
awards.description: Shishani was winner of competition "Cultuur in de stad" ("Culture in the City").

awards.title: Winner singer-songwriter competition "Mooie Noten" 2013
awards.description:
“Shishani is the winner of the 2013 "Mooie Noten" singer-songwriter competition in Amsterdam. The jury was impressed by the Namibian-born artist. "She's good with the audience," has "strong lyrics" and "has something to say." The jury stated she could go straight to Lowlands and North Sea Jazz Festival. 

http://www.grap.net/p/28.html?article_id=360#.UiGbERsvXpw

awards.title: Winner Last Band Standing 2012
awards.description:
Winner of Live Band competition "Last Band Standing" in Namibia, May 2012.

http://www.dstv.com/News/Shishani-Left-Standing/94071
awards.issuer: National Theatre of Namibia's Last Band Standing Competition

awards.title: Winner Best Vocals at "StreetLife" Talent show 2010
awards.description: Koron & Shishani won first prize in the category "Best Vocals" at a talent show in Den Haag named "Streetlife." This talent show was organized by Culturalis - a former arts centre in The Hangue, The Netherlands.
awards.issuer: Streetlife Den Haag - organized by Culturalis

profile_positions.description:
MUSIC
Shishani is a Namibian/Belgian singer-songwriter and activist who grew up in the Netherlands.The spread of her music and message was recognized when her song "Minority" was nominated for Best Single Non Album and Best Music Video at the 2013 Namibian Annual Music Awards. "Minority" has been featured on various international LGBTI blogs and radio stations, and she has performed for various causes (protests, benefits,etc.) Shishani addresses social issues in her music, such as her song "Clean Country" which she wrote for the Campaign song for the Campaign Against Nuclear Waste in Namibia. In 2012 she won the Last Band Standing Competition in Namibia, headlined the Windhoek Jazz Festival 2012 alongside Lira & Selaelo Selota. In 2013, she won the Amsterdam singer-songwriter music competition 'Mooie Noten' because she “has strong lyrics and something to say.” Shishani's the winner of Amsterdam TV Channel AT5 talent competition" Cultuur in de Stad" (2014) and is currently in the finals for the prestigious Radio France International Discovery Awards 2014 - celebrating artists from Africa. 

She has performed in The Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg,Germany, Ireland, Ibiza, Czech Republic, Poland, Greece, Malawi, Morocco, Namibia and South Africa. 

ORGANIZATIONS
Shishani is co-founder of the cultural events organisation called  'Cinnamon Amsterdam' (2010-now).

Shishani is co-founder of ARTNAM, an organisation promoting Namibian artists in Namibia and abroad (2012-now)
profile_positions.title: Artist Songwriter Musician Activist
